676.text: MEGA is Cloud Storage with Powerful Always-On Privacy

677.text: MEGA provides robust cloud storage with convenient and powerful always-on privacy. MEGA believes in your right to privacy and provides you with the technology tools to protect it. We call it User Controlled Encryption, or UCE, and it happens automatically.

678.text: What is MEGA User Controlled Encryption?

679.text: All files stored on MEGA are encrypted. All data transfers from and to MEGA are encrypted. And while most cloud storage providers can and do claim the same, MEGA is different – unlike the industry norm where the cloud storage provider holds the decryption key, with MEGA, you control the encryption, you hold the keys, and you decide who you grant or deny access to your files, without requiring any risky software installs. It's all happening in your web browser!

681.text: The MEGA cloud is just the beginning. In the future, MEGA will provide UCE in your browser for a wide range of applications without the need to install anything. Our technology will protect your emails, calls, chats and video streams.

1142.context:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography

Public-key cryptography, also known as asymmetric cryptography, refers to a cryptographic algorithm which requires two separate keys one of which is secret (or private) and one of which is public. Although different, the two parts of this key pair are mathematically linked. The public key is used to encrypt plaintext or to verify a digital signature; whereas the private key is used to decrypt ciphertext or to create a digital signature.

1144.text: The earliest known use of cryptography relates back to almost 4000 years ago, in ancient Egypt

1145.text: Today, 4000 years later, most major cloud storage providers still have not fully adopted cryptography.

1822.text: MEGA was architected around the simple fact that cryptography, for it to be accepted and used, must not interfere with usability. MEGA is fully accessible without prior software installs and remains the only cloud storage provider with browser-based high-performance end-to-end encryption. The only visible signs of the crypto layer operating under MEGA's hood are the entropy collection during signup, the lack of a password reset feature and the novel (and browser-specific) ways file transfers are conducted. Today, millions of business and personal users rely on MEGA to securely and reliably store and serve petabytes of data and we believe that this success is the result of MEGA's low barrier to entry to a more secure cloud.

1823.text: We are constantly hiring. If you are an outstanding software engineer and would like to join our global team, please do not hesitate to submit your CV to jobs@mega.nz.

1935.text: If you have a backup of your master crypto key, you can reset your password by selecting YES. No data will be lost.

1936.text: You can still [A]export[/A] your Recovery Key now if you have an active MEGA session in any other browser on this or any other computer. If you don't, you can no longer decrypt your existing account, but you can start a new one under the same e-mail address by selecting NO.
1936.context: Explanation of how the user can still get a copy of their master encryption key (now renamed "Recovery Key") if they are still logged in anywhere. Otherwise they can't unlock their account.

1942.text: Due to our end-to-end encryption paradigm, you will not be able to access your data without either your password or a [A]backup[/A] of your Recovery Key.
1942.context: Instructions explaining that we have encrypted a user's data, and so we can't help them unless they remember their password or have a backup/copy of their master encryption key (now renamed "Recovery Key")

1943.text: You can park your existing account and start a fresh one under the same e-mail address. In the event that you recall your parked account's password, please contact [A]support@mega.nz[/A] for recovery assistance. Your data will be retained for at least 60 days.

1948.text: You have lost your password and cannot provide a previously exported Recovery Key? Unfortunately, due to MEGA's use of strong cryptography, the loss of your Recovery Key renders all of your data unreadable. If you proceed, you will start a fresh account under your existing e-mail address. Your old account will remain parked for at least 60 days and can be recovered by contacting [A]support@mega.nz[/A] in the event that you still recall your password.
1948.context: Explanation explaining that without their password or their master encryption key (now renamed "Recovery Key"), the user can't unlock their account.

1984.text: Your data is only readable through a chain of decryption operations that begins with your master encryption key (Recovery Key), which we store encrypted with your password. This means that if you lose your password, your Recovery Key can no longer be decrypted, and you can no longer decrypt your data.
1984.context: Detailed explanation of how the master encryption key (now renamed "Recovery Key") works, and why it is important to remember your password.

1985.text: Exporting the Recovery Key and keeping it in a secure location enables you to set a new password without data loss.
1985.context: Explanation of why it is good to keep a backup of your master encryption key (now renamed "Recovery Key")

5526.text:
MEGA is a secure cloud storage service that gives you 50 GB for free.Unlike other cloud storage providers, your data is encrypted and decrypted by the client devices only and never by us.
Your data is accessible any time, from any device, anywhere. Share folders with your contacts and see their updates in real time.
The cloud in your pocket. Access and stream your files from your smartphone or tablet. Upload and sync your media to the cloud.
Search, store, download, stream, view, share, rename or delete your files. It's all there - in the palm of your hands.
For more info, please check our website: https://mega.nz/

5835.text:
With PhotoSync, the photos you take with your iPhone will be automatically backed up to MEGA.
You can use WiFi or cellular connection and by enabling Background mode the app will upload photos when your location changes significantly.

Passcode lock adds a new layer of security by requiring a four-digit passcode to be entered every time the app is launched. This will protect your files even if your iPhone falls into the wrong hands. There is also an option to erase all data and logout if the wrong password is entered over 10 times.

Various bug fixes and speed improvements.

Your feedback is very important to us and, although we might not answer every email, we read each and every one.

Also, your 5-stars rating in the AppStore is always appreciated.

Alert message shown when a restore hasn't been completed correctly.
That happens when the restore queue does not include any transaction, which can be caused by either that the user has not yet made a purchase or the user's prior purchase is not available. 7680.text: MEGA's cryptographic model depends on the keys displayed above. We recommend sending the decryption keys separately from the folder/file link, through a secure channel.
7680.context:
An explanation about what the two parts of a public link are for. The first sentence explains why both parts are required, but the second sentence recommends they be sent to other people separately, in two different messages.

One part of the link is the 'folder/file link'. The other part is the 'decryption key'.

7682.text: MEGA recommends sending the 'Decryption Key' separately from the 'Folder/File Link'.
7682.context: This is used in the Export/Get Link menu option to explain the best method for sending the two separate parts of the full link.

7683.context: This refers to either our Firefox Extension or Chrome Extension.

7684.context: This is used as a session description to show a browser on an operating system platform, e.g. 'Firefox on Windows' or 'Chrome on Linux". Only the word 'on' needs translation, please keep %1 and %2.

7685.text: I hereby state that I have a good faith belief that the use of copyrighted material in the manner complained of and located at the location above is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law (e.g., as a fair use).
7685.context:
A legal statement on the copyright notice page when a takedown complaint is being created. This is a revision of the existing string id 635.

The user has just entered details of their complaint, including mentioning the specific file link that they want to be taken down, and are having to confirm that they truly believe this is illegal use of the material, and not allowed by the law or fair use.

7686.text: One of the links you have provided is not a valid MEGA link.
7686.context: This appears within an error dialog. The user has typed or copied & pasted a link into our takedown system, but the link has not passed our validation and does not look like a MEGA link.

7687.text: Transfer settings are for registered users only.
7687.context: Message shown when unregistered users try to access the transfer settings.

7688.text: There may be a man-in-the-middle attack in progress. Please reset the stored identification credentials for this contact and then verify that they are correct with your contact through an existing secure channel or in person.
7688.context:
Warning text on the fingerprint warning dialog. The user should reset their fingerprint credentials and verify them properly.
This involves comparing the numbers they can see on their own screen, with the numbers their contact can see on their screen.

7689.context:
Title text on the fingerprint warning dialog. This will reset the contact's fingerprint credentials to what is currently loaded.
A credential in this case is a stored piece of information representing the identity of the contact. Giving anybody presenting the same information the authenticity of that contact.

7690.text: Use the reset button below to reset the credentials for this contact.
7690.context: Button text on the fingerprint warning dialog. This instructs the user to reset the contact's fingerprint credentials.

7691.context: Title text for the fingerprint warning dialog after a reset has occurred. This is the new fingerprint credentials for the contact, following a reset.

7692.context: Title for a section on the fingerprint warning dialog. Below it is a button which will allow the user to verify their contact's fingerprint credentials.

7693.text: Use the Verify button below to confirm the credentials for this contact.
7693.context: Description for a section on the fingerprint warning dialog. This tells the user to click a button labelled 'Verify' to verify their contact's fingerprint credentials.

7696.context: A title for the Copyright Warning dialog. Designed to make the user feel as though this is not targeting them, but is a warning for everybody who uses our service.

7698.text: You have successfully changed your profile.

7706.text: Your MEGA voucher for %1 € was redeemed successfully
7706.context: Title for the redeem voucher dialog. The %1 will be replaced with a number e.g. 4.99 or 9.99 so please do not remove it. Do not remove the € symbol either.

7707.context: Text on the redeem voucher dialog explaining what the user's account balance is. The %1 will be replaced with a number e.g. 9.99 so please do not remove it. Do not remove the € symbol either.

7708.text: We suggest the %1 plan based on your account balance.
7708.context: Text on the voucher redeem dialog. This suggests which plan the user should purchase based on their current account balance. The %1 will be replaced with the name of the Pro plan e.g. PRO II or PRO III so please do not remove it.

7709.text: Click [S]COMPLETE UPGRADE[/S] and enjoy your new %1 plan.
7709.context:
Text on the voucher redeem dialog. This tells the user to click the COMPLETE UPGRADE button which will upgrade their account to the recommended Pro plan. Do not remove the [S] or [/S] tags which will be replaced with stylized content. 
Do however translate the words "COMPLETE UPGRADE". 
The %1 will be replaced with the name of the Pro plan e.g. PRO II or PRO III so please do not remove it either.

7710.context:
Button text on the voucher redeem dialog. This will complete their account upgrade to the recommended Pro plan.
This is capitalised on purpose.

7873.text: You can download the extension (v%1) below.
7873.context: This text is on the Chrome or Firefox extension pages and tells the user they can download a specific version of the extension further down the page. The placeholder %1 will be replaced with the version of the extension e.g. "3.2.8". So the text would read "You can download the extension (v3.2.8) below."

7874.text: It looks like your current extension (v%1) is out of date. You can download the latest (v%2) below.
7874.context: This text is on the Chrome or Firefox extension pages and tells the user that the current extension they have installed is not the latest version. The placeholder %1 will be replaced with the current version of the extension e.g. "3.2.7". The placeholder %2 will be replaced with the newest version available for download e.g. "3.2.8". So the text would read "It looks like your current extension (v3.2.7) is out of date. You can download the latest (v3.2.8) below."

7875.text: Your extension (v%1) is up to date.
7875.context: This text is on the Chrome or Firefox extension pages and tells the user that the current extension they have installed is the latest version. The placeholder %1 will be replaced with the current version of the extension e.g. "3.2.8". So the text would read "Your extension (v3.2.8) is up to date."

7879.context: This is shown in the Notification dialog when a user removes a contact from their contact list. The placeholder [X] will be replaced with the removed contact's email address.

7945.context: An instruction message on the Enter Decryption Key dialog. This prompts the user that they will need a key to decrypt and access the file or folder. The [B] and [/B] placeholder tags are used to bolden the text and should not be removed in the translated text. Do however translate the "Decryption key" text inside the placeholders.

7946.text: If you do not have it, ask the creator of the link.
7946.context: The second instruction message on the Enter Decryption Key dialog. This prompts the user that if they do not have the decryption key they will need to ask the creator of the link for it.

7971.context: This is button text on the Get Link dialog. Also it's used as placeholder text on the Enter Decryption Key dialog. A decryption key is a string of random characters e.g. !3uv6GhJhAWWH46fcMN2KGRtxc_QSLthcwvAdaA_TjCE.

7972.text: If you do not have the key, contact the creator of the link.
7972.context: An instruction message on the Enter Decryption Key dialog. This tells the user to ask the creator of the public file link to get the decryption key if they do not have it already.

8080.text: MEGA protects your chat with end-to-end (user controlled) encryption providing essential safety assurances:
8080.context:
Full text:

MEGA protects your chat with end-to-end (user controlled) encryption providing essential safety assurances:

Confidentiality - Only the author and intended recipients are able to decipher and read the content.

Authenticity - There is an assurance that the message received was authored by the stated sender, and its content has not been tampered with during transport or on the server.

8514.text: Subscriptions are renewed automatically for successive subscription periods of the same duration and at the same price as the initial period chosen. You can switch off the automatic renewal of your MEGA PRO subscription no later than 24 hours before your next subscription payment is due via your iTunes account settings page. To manage your subscriptions, simply click on the App Store icon on your handset, sign in with your Apple ID at the bottom of the page (if you haven't already done so) and then click View ID. You'll be taken to your account page where you can scroll down to Manage App Subscriptions. From there, you can select your MEGA PRO subscription and view your scheduled renewal date, choose a different subscription package or toggle the on-off switch to off to disable the auto-renewal of your subscription.

8771.context: Title for the copyright counter-notice page that gives information on how to dispute a takedown

8772.context: Sub title for the copyright counter-notice page that gives information on the step by step process to dispute a takedown by sending a counter-notification

8773.text: MEGA processes all takedown notices submitted to us based on good faith acceptance of the representations from the party submitting the takedown notice. Due to our end-to-end encryption model we have to do so without being able to review the files. Even if we could decrypt them, we could not determine the copyright status without complex analysis and review, which is impractical for the number of files processed each day. We are aware that some agencies submit incorrect takedown notices from time to time, but we are unable to find such errors in advance.
8773.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This paragraph explains why we have to allow takedowns through without human review.

8774.text: You may file a counter-notice if you believe that access to a file you have uploaded has been wrongly disabled because it was the subject of an incorrect takedown notice. You should only do so if you are confident that no other party owns copyright in the material, or you have rights to store the material and, if you are sharing it, that you have the right to do so.
8774.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This paragraph lets the user know that they can file a dispute, but only under certain conditions.

8775.text: We can only accept a counter-notification directly from the user from whose MEGA account the URL or file has been disabled. For verification, counter-notifications must be submitted from the email address associated with the MEGA account.
8775.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This paragraph informs the user that they have to be logged into the account that suffered the takedown.

8776.text: Upon receipt of a counter-notification, MEGA will promptly provide the person who provided the takedown notification with a copy of the counter-notification, and inform that person that MEGA will replace the removed material or cease disabling access to it in 10 business days. If MEGA does not receive any further communication from or on behalf of the person who originally submitted the takedown notice, or such communication that it does receive does not in MEGA's sole opinion adequately justify the original takedown notice, MEGA may, but shall not be obliged to, reinstate the material in approximately 10-14 business days provided it has no reason to believe that the material infringes copyright.
8776.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This paragraph informs the user of the steps Mega will take after receiving the counter notice.

8777.text: Nothing in this policy prejudices MEGA's right, agreed to by each user in MEGA's Terms of Service, to remove or disable access to any material at any time, for any reason or no reason.
8777.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This paragraph informs the user that our Terms of Service still apply and that we can take things down for reasons other than copyright takedowns

8778.text: To file a counter-notification with us, you may click the button below to proceed to our dispute form.
8778.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This tells the user where to click.

8779.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This is the start of a series of bullet points explaining in fine detail the points that the user must consider before doing a dispute

8780.text: When we receive your counter-notice, we pass it, including your address and other contact information, to the party who issued the original takedown notice. By submitting your counter-notice you authorise us to do so;
8780.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This informs the user that the details they type will be passed on to the complainant who make the original takedown

8781.text: Filing a counter-notification may lead to legal proceedings between you and the complaining party;
8781.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This informs the user that this could lead to court

8782.text: There may be adverse legal consequences in New Zealand and/or your jurisdiction if you make a false or bad faith allegation by using this process;
8782.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. You can get in trouble with the law for providing bad information

8783.text: If, when using this counter-notice process, you make a false or bad faith allegation or otherwise breach MEGA’s Terms of Service or this policy and that causes MEGA any loss, costs (including legal costs), damages or other liability, MEGA reserves the right to claim for and recover from you that loss, those costs (including full legal costs on a solicitor client basis), damages and other liability, by deduction from any balance in our account and/or by proceedings in New Zealand and/or the jurisdiction of the address in your counter-notice;
8783.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. Mega can claim costs and other things in court if you provide bad information during a dispute

8784.text: This counter-notice process is provided voluntarily by MEGA for the purposes of all applicable copyright takedown and counter-notice regimes in other jurisdictions, but, in doing so, MEGA does not submit itself to any jurisdiction or law other than New Zealand as set out in its Terms of Service. MEGA may amend, suspend or withdraw this counter-notice process at any time, provided that any counter-notices in train at that time shall continue to be processed.
8784.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. Mega makes this available for all jurisdictions that will accept it, but Mega does not agree to be governed by those laws, and is only 'submitting itself' to New Zealand law

8785.text: By filing a counter-notice, you are deemed to have accepted the above terms. If you do not accept the above terms, do not file a counter-notice.
8785.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. The user should not fill out the form if they did not agree with the things they just read about

8786.text: If there is any inconsistency or ambiguity between the English and other language versions of the above terms, the English version shall prevail.
8786.context: Information regarding the copyright takedown dispute process. This states that the english version of this legal wording is the one that counts, if there is any disagreement between language versions

8787.text: You may submit a counter-notification here
8787.context: The button label for submitting a copyright counter-notification

8788.context: Do not translate 'Mega Limited' as that is the company's name. This is a title for the copyright agent for Mega Limited

8789.context: Title for the copyright dispute counter-notification form

8790.text: This notification is a serious legal document - please be careful to be accurate in your copyright infringement counter-notification. You may first wish to consult with an attorney to determine whether you have ownership of the content, or are protected by fair use, license, or other legal basis.
8790.context: Subheading for the copyright counter-notification form explaining that it is serious business.

8819.text: You have already made a counter-notification against this link.
8819.context:
A message inside an error dialog.
The user has just tried to dispute a takedown by sending MEGA a takedown counter-notification.
However they have already done this before, so they will see this error.

A counter-notification means "Sending a notice back to the complainant (who sent MEGA a takedown notice for the link), that counters (or is against) the notice you received".

[Alice Jones]
was changed to Moderator by John Smith

10644.text: Unless otherwise provided by law or by a particular service offer, all purchases are final and non-refundable. If you believe that Mega has charged you in error, you must contact us within 90 days of such charge. No refunds will be given for any charges more than 90 days old. We reserve the right to issue refunds or credits at our sole discretion. If we issue a refund or credit, we are under no obligation to issue the same or similar refund in the future. This refund policy does not affect any statutory rights that may apply. If you have made a payment by mistake and have not used the subscription plan services, you must contact [A]support@mega.nz[/A] within 24 hours. This will be acknowledged promptly and answered within 7 days.
10644.context: A section about payment refunds on the #general information page. Please do not remove or modify the [A] tags which will be replaced with a hyperlink.

10648.text: Recurring subscriptions will renew indefinitely, either monthly or annually, based upon your chosen subscription period unless the subscription is cancelled prior to a renewal date. For recurring subscriptions established via the Android or iOS in-app-purchase platforms, you should refer to the Google or Apple platform for details of the dates and terms of the subscription. Any other recurring subscription will recur on the same day of month as it was established, except in cases where the day is not available due to a short month, where the recur date will be moved to the first day of the following month.
10648.context: The section on the #general information page about recurring payment subscriptions.

10649.context: The title of a section on the #general information page about cancelling payment subscriptions.

10650.text: Recurring subscriptions established through the Android or iOS in-app-purchase platforms should be cancelled through the Google or Apple service directly. Any other recurring subscription should be cancelled by navigating to [A]mega.nz/#account[/A] in your browser and selecting the option to cancel your subscription. Any payments processed after an effective subscription cancellation will be promptly refunded by Mega. If a subscription is cancelled, access to the account may be restricted or blocked if the level of use is above the limits applying to free accounts at that time.

12489.text: When we launched MEGA early 2013, global mass surveillance by rogue governments under the pretext of fighting terrorism was still a wild conjecture and its proponents were often touted as conspiracy theorists. Edward Snowden's revelations 137 days later fundamentally changed public attitudes and it became excruciatingly clear that [I]security by policy[/I] ("we have access to your data, but we promise to keep it confidential and not misuse it") had not been good enough. Anything short of [I]security by design[/I] ("we cannot gain access to your data without you being able to find out"), for which strong end-to-end encryption is an essential prerequisite, now seems grossly insufficient.
12489.context: An introduction message on the https://mega.nz/#about page. Please leave the [I] and [/I] tags because they will be replaced with italic text. This should have already been translated in string 1821, so you can borrow that translation if need be. The difference is that the HTML tags have now been removed.

16361.context: Informs the user that their storage is almost full and it is time for the user to consider upgrading. This message is intended for users who are already PRO, so does not mention PRO accounts.

16362.text: Subject to your participation in our achievements program.
16362.context: A message shown at registration time when users have to select their plan. The FREE 50 GB plan is subject to the achievements program.

16363.text: Your easy route to more storage & transfer quota on MEGA
16363.context: This is the Achievements dialog header. A user is able to increase free storage and transfer quota by completing achievements.

16364.text: You can maintain a generous free storage and transfer allowance by completing any of the actions outlined below.
16364.context: Information on the Achievements dialog. The user is able to increase free storage and transfer quota by completing achievements.

16365.context: A dialog header. The user is able to increase the amount of free storage and transfer quota by completing achievements like installing MEGAsync, or an app etc.

16368.text: MEGA is a secure cloud storage service that gives you 50 GB free storage space. Unlike other cloud storage providers, your data is encrypted and decrypted by your client devices only and never by us.
16368.context: Paragraph 1 of the general description of MEGA shown on the apps stores in Android, iOS and Windows Phone.

16369.text: Upload your files from your smartphone or tablet, then search, store, download, stream, view, share, rename or delete your files any time, from any device, anywhere. Share folders with your contacts and see their updates in real time.
16369.context: Paragraph 2 of the general description of MEGA shown on the apps stores in Android, iOS and Windows Phone.

16370.text: The encryption process means we cannot access or reset your password so you MUST remember it (unless you have your Recovery Key backed up) or you will lose access to your stored files.
16370.context: Paragraph 3 of the general description of MEGA which is shown on the app stores in Android, iOS and Windows Phone.

16371.text: Inside the app you can upgrade your storage space and transfer quota with a monthly or yearly subscription.
16371.context: Paragraph 4 of the general description of MEGA which is shown on the app stores in Android, iOS and Windows Phone.

16373.text:
For more info, please check our website:
Mobile - https://mega.nz/mobile_terms.html - https://mega.nz/mobile_privacy.html
Desktop - https://mega.nz/
16373.context: Paragraph 6 of the general description of MEGA which is shown on the app stores in Android, iOS and Windows Phone. Please keep the multiple line format.

16374.text: Note: For desktop access to your files, MEGA needs to use HTML5 compatible browsers to handle our advanced features. We recommend Mozilla Firefox and Google Chrome. The mobile versions of browsers cannot access the MEGA cloud storage system yet.
16374.context: Paragraph 7 of the general description of MEGA which is shown on the app stores in Android, iOS and Windows Phone.

16375.context: A title of a text block describing a benefit of MEGA's storage.

16406.text:
[1]MEGA Account Reset

[2]It looks like you have forgotten your password and do not have a backup of your Recovery Key.

[3]If you proceed, the existing account under this address will be deactivated, and you will lose access to your data. The data will still be preserved for at least another 60 days. Should you remember the deactivated account's password or locate its previously exported Recovery Key, please contact [A1]support@mega.nz[/A1] to have it restored.

[4]Even if you manage to restore the deactivated account, all associated contacts and shares will remain deleted and need to be re-established.

[5]Reset my Account

[6]Didn't work? No worries. Copy and paste this link below into your web browser:

[1]MEGA Account Suspended - Repeat Infringer

[2]YOUR ACCOUNT HAS BEEN SUSPENDED OVER REPEATED ALLEGATIONS OF COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENTS.

[3]Please do not hesitate to contact us at [A1]legal@mega.nz[/A1] if you believe the allegations are false.

[4]Please be reminded that MEGA respects the copyrights of others and requires that users of the MEGA cloud service comply with the laws of copyright. You are strictly prohibited from using the MEGA cloud service to infringe copyrights. You may not upload, download, store, share, display, stream, distribute, e-mail, link to, transmit or otherwise make available any files, data, or content that infringes any copyright or other proprietary rights of any person or entity.

[5]Pursuant to our Terms of Service, accounts found to be repeat infringers are subject to termination. Full details, including how to file a counter notification, are specified in MEGA's [A2]Terms of Service[/A2], [A3]Copyright[/A3] and [A4]Takedown Guidance[/A4]

[1]Welcome to MEGA

[2]Hi [$username], thanks for joining MEGA, your free account is ready and you can start using MEGA now.

[3][B]Warning:[/B] Due to our advanced end-to-end encryption, it is mathematically impossible for us to recover or reset your password. If you lose your password, you will lose access to the data in your MEGA account. We highly recommend you make a backup of your Recovery Key now:

[7]Visit Mega.nz

16440.text:
[1]About MEGA

[2]Privacy

[3]Unlike most other cloud storage providers, only you control who has access to your data. Not even MEGA can access your data!

[4]Encryption

[5]Your data is encrypted on your device using your password as the encryption key. Secure collaboration with others is guaranteed through asymmetric cryptography, which means that only the end points have access.

[6]Space

[7]Not only is MEGA more secure than its major competitors, MEGA is also very generous in providing a whopping 50GB for free!

[8]Not only is MEGA more secure than its major competitors, MEGA provides a very generous amount of free storage and transfer quota, and easy ways to [A1]achieve[/A1] even more for free!

PRO I subscription: €9.99 (US$9.99) per month or €99.99 (US$99.99) per year gives you 1 TB of storage space and 2 TB of transfer quota per month.

16902.text: Or create a free MEGA account. Registered users enjoy an extra 10% free IP quota allowance.

17034.text: Your data is only readable through a chain of decryption operations that begins with your master encryption key, which we store encrypted with your password. This means that if you lose your password, your master key can no longer be decrypted, and you can no longer decrypt your data.

17037.text: If you have a backup of your Recovery Key, you can reset your password by selecting YES. No data will be lost.

17038.text: You can still export your Recovery Key now if you have an active MEGA session in another browser on this or any other computer. If you don't, you can no longer decrypt your existing account, but you can start a new one under the same e-mail address by selecting NO.
